column2: Anadarko reports quarterly loss on Tronox settlement May 5 Anadarko Petroleum Corp on Monday reported a big quarterly loss compared with a year-ago profit as the U.S. oil and gas company paid a previously announced $5.15 billion settlement related to Tronox Ltd litigation.

column2: Shareholder ends lawsuit against IBM over China risks
column3: NSA scandal NEW YORK
column4: May 5 An IBM Corp shareholder has voluntarily ended a lawsuit accusing the company of concealing how its cooperation with a National Security Agency spying program cost it business in China and led to a nearly $13 billion plunge in the company's market value.

column2: JPMorgan $280 mln mortgage accord gets preliminary court approval NEW YORK
column3: May 5 JPMorgan Chase & Co has won preliminary approval from a U.S. judge for its agreement to pay $280 million to resolve claims that it misled investors in billions of dollars worth of mortgage-backed securities.

column2: Nokia says to widen Juniper cooperation to cloud services HELSINKI
column3: May 5 Finnish telecommunications equipment maker Nokia said on Monday that it would extend its cooperation with peer Juniper Networks to mobile internet-based cloud services.

column2: PointState Capital's Schreiber likes Valero
column3: Marathon Petroleum NEW YORK
column4: May 5 PointState Capital's Zach Schreiber said on Monday that he recommended the shares of Valero Energy Co and Marathon Petroleum Corp  because he sees crude prices falling and says U.S. refiners will benefit.

column2: UPDATE 1-TrueCar's IPO may value company at about $1 bln * To list on the Nasdaq under symbol "TRUE"   (Adds details)
ON THE MOVE-Morgan Stanley hires advisers from UBS May 5 Morgan Stanley's wealth management unit said on Monday that it hired veteran advisers from UBS AG  for its Louisville office.
Europe Factors to Watch-Shares set to inch up in thin volumes PARIS
column3: May 5 European stocks were set to inch higher on Monday in thin volumes as UK markets were closed for a holiday
column4: with gains set to be capped following soft Chinese manufacturing data.     At 0613 GMT
column6: for Germany's DAX  and for France's CAC were flat to up 0.2 percent.     The final reading of China's HSBC/Markit purchasing managers index (PMI) for April came in at 48.1
column7: lower than a preliminary reading of 48.3 but up slightly from an eight-month low

column2: Occidental Petroleum profit rises on higher crude
column3: natgas prices May 5 Occidental Petroleum Corp
column4: the fourth-largest U.S. oil and gas company
column5: reported a 2.6 percent rise in first-quarter profit
column6: helped by higher prices for crude oil and natural gas.

column2: Coke to remove controversial chemical from Fanta
column3: other drinks NEW YORK
column4: May 5 The Coca-Cola Company  said on Monday it will remove a controversial flavoring stabilizer from some of its drinks
column5: following rival PepsiCo Inc's announcement earlier this year that it would drop the same ingredient from its drinks.
